intro: Ceropegia somalilandica, commonly known as the Somaliland milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Somalia. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its trailing stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant produces a milky sap, which is typical of many species in its family. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its unique floral structure attracts specific pollinators, making it an important species in its native ecosystem.
